III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth I and another unidentified youth allegedly had sexual
contact in a bathroom at the facility between 3/24/23 - 8/31/23.
Investigation I reviewed the facility’s history of licensing violations.
I notified Complainant who is also Youth I’s Foster Care Worker
of this investigation assignment. She expressed no concerns
about the facility.
Former Youth I is currently placed with Foster Parent. I
contacted Youth I’s Foster Parent who was aware of the
allegation. She gave me permission to interview Youth I via
phone.
I notified Rights Officer of the allegation and arrived at the facility
unannounced on 9/6/23. Rights Officer advised me that while at
Vista Maria, Former Youth I identified as a transgender male and
preferred he/him pronouns. However, to his knowledge, Youth I
has not “come out” to his current Foster Parent and prefers to the
pronouns she/her in the foster home. I requested any incident
reports involving Former Youth I and another youth in the
bathroom and/or any reports involving both Former Youth I and
Youth A. Rights Officer searched Vista Maria’s data system and
there are no incidents.
I interviewed Former Youth I, age 12, and asked if she had
concerns about anything that happened at Vista Maria. She said,
“No.” I told her someone reported she and another youth had
sexual contact in a bathroom at Vista Maria. She sounded
surprised and responded, “What? No. I never said I had sex in a
bathroom. I don’t know where you’re getting that from.” I asked
Former Youth I if she was ever inside a bathroom with another
youth. She said, “Once Youth A was upset so I went in there
(bathroom) and talked to her. I’m kind of confused about who said
this…Youth A didn’t do anything. No. That didn’t happen.”
2

Former Youth I said she had no concerns relative to her stay at
Vista Maria.
I interviewed Youth A, age 16. Youth A said she identifies as
non-binary and prefers they/them pronouns. I asked Youth A if
they knew Former Youth I and they were visibly concerned. I
reassured them Former Youth I is “okay” and they appeared
relieved. I told Youth A that someone reported a concern that
Youth I had sexual contact with another youth in a bathroom at
Vista Maria and mentioned their name. They appeared amused
and stated, “No. That didn’t happen.” I asked Youth A about their
relationship with Former Youth I at Vista Maria. They described
them as “best friends” explaining, “He (Youth I) was like a younger
brother to me.”
I asked Youth A if they were ever in the bathroom with Former
Youth I. They said they may have been in the bathroom together
but were always supervised by staff. “Staff usually stand by the
door looking inside.” I asked Youth A if Former Youth I ever told
them he had sexual contact with any other youths at Vista Maria
inside or outside the bathroom. They replied, “No.”
I interviewed Staff 1 with Rights Officer present. She has worked
at Vista Maria for two years and was familiar with Youth A and
Former Youth I. Staff 1 said Youths A and I generally got along
well together and sometimes argued like siblings would. “They
played with barbie dolls in Youth I’s dollhouse.” Staff 1 noticed
nothing unusual or concerning about their relationship.
Analysis Evidence does not support the allegation that sexual contact
occurred between Former Youth I and another unidentified youth
at Vista Maria. Therefore, there were no issues identified
regarding a lack of supervision by staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
